titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the John Cope Caldwell Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

index.head: INDEX JOHN COPE CALDWELL
index.p: This is a name index of the correspondents of John Cope Caldwell. The figure (or figures) in parentheses immediately following each name denotes the total number of letters from that person in the collection; the dates are for the time of the letters. The last number given refers to the box in which the correspondence may be found. ( See Index Number 2.)

index.head: INDEX 2 JOHN COPE CALDWELL
index.p: This is a name index of the correspondents of John and Elsie Caldwell. The figure (or figures) in parentheses immediately following each name denotes the total number of letters from that person in the collection; the dates are for the time of the letters. The full name of the writer is given whenever possible; 1 letter is without a surname. The signature on this letter is Paul. The last number given refers to the box in which the correspondence may be found.
index.indexentry: Galinski, Naomi, (3)7 Aug. 15, 1967 (to Joan Butler), Nov. 25, 1966 (to Richard J. Walsh, Jr.), Dec. 2, 1966(to Richard J. Walsh, Jr.); 25

index.head: INDEX 3 JOHN COPE CALDWELL
index.p: This is a name index of the correspondents of John and Elsie Caldwell. The figure (or figures) in parentheses immediately following each name denotes the total number of letters from that person in the collection; the dates are for the time of the letters. Three letters are without surname and are listed at the end. This correspondence is found in manuscript box 36.

indexentry.ref: (1) April 23, 1969 - zeroxed copy of letter to Mrs. Grace Guerini

note.p: 14 small and 2 large day-books of Asian, African, and South American travels. Holograph. Three brief autobiographies(1951)- typescript and 2 biographies typescript. Travel schedules- 98 schedules from 1950 to 1962.
Outgoing correspondence of 569 letters, chronologically arranged by days and months. Letters are typewritten, carbon copies. Few are mimeographed. 36 undated letters.

Incoming correspondnece of 3,022 letters, 30 telegrams, alphabetically arranged. Letters are typewritten. with the exception of a few Holograph. Few are carbon copies. There are 196 illegible and unsigned letters.

Chronologically arranged by year. Articles and reports from Nashville, Tennessee, papers. Also numerous statements, which are typewritten, are included. These statements refer to activities of various government officials and Caldwell's opinion of these individuals. Also’ a statement of Communist activities before the Internal Security Commission.

Magazine and Newspaper articles, material by Caldwell. Articles and short publications by Caldwell, dated and undated. Chronologically arranged by the year. Serial articles to brief references; mostly of social and political concerns.

did.unittitle: Unpublished articles - Articles by Caldwell; dated and undated. Chronologically arranged by years. Serial articles to brief references; mainly of social and political concerns. Typewritten and mimeographed.

Book Drafts, gallies, and manuscripts. Books arranged alphabetically by titles. Typewritten, carbon copies. Family, The Clarke Story, Communism in Our World, The Eagle and his R.0.K.1s, Far East Travel Guide, Far Pacific Travel Guide, From Chiang Kai shek's Diaries, I Went to School in Red China, The Korea Story, Let's Visit America's Ambassadors, Let's Visit Argentina, Let's Visit Australia, Let's Visit Brazil, Let's Visit Canada, Let's Visit Central America, Let's Visit Ceylon, Let's Visit Chile, Let's Visit China, Let's Visit Columbia, Let's Visit India, Let's Visit Indonesia, Let's Visit Japan, Let's Visit Korea, Let's Visit Mexico, Let's Visit Middle East, Let's Visit New Zealand, Let's Visit Pakistan, Let's Visit Peru, Let's Visit the Philippines, Let's Visit the South Pacific, Let's Visit Southeast Asia, Let's Visit Thailand, Let's Visit Venezuela, Let's Visit Vietnam, Let's Visit West Africa, Let's Visit the West Indies, Ling Ceng and the Payoff, Manpogee, a Story of Korea, Our Neighbors in Africa, Our Neighbors in Brazil, Our Neighbors in India, Our Neighbors in Korea, Our Neighbors in Peru, The Overseas Chinese, The Pilleys of Borneo, Recollections of the Marshall Mission, Rush Me More Orphans, South Korea - Democracy or Dictatorship, South of Tokyo, Still the Rice Grains Green, The Story of Japan, We the People, What's it Like on Formosa, When Budda Came to Bathe, Untitled Manuscript

Blurbs and Printed Weekly Series. Weekly serial stories for Sunday Digest and Sunday Pix. Arranged by chronology. Typewritten. China Coast Family, Terror by Night, The Tiger Hunter. Lecture Notes - Typewritten and holograph. 9 sets of lecture notes.

note.p: Television and radio notes and addresses. Typewritten and chronologically arranged. One short undated announcement
Questions and notes on Chiang Kai-shek. Sections of the General's diary and answers to Caldwell's questions.
Passports and Authorization Papers - Papers are in English and Chinese. Typewritten.

did.unittitle: Publisher contracts and other legal documents. Arranged Chronologically.

note.p: Southern Observer. Two copies which are arranged chronologically. Caldwell was the "Book
Review Editor", or "Literary Editor".
Book Reviews amd Book Advertisements. Undated or arranged by year.
Lecture announcements and advertisements.
Letters of U. S. soldiers to unwed mothers in Japan. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Photographs - 343 photographs of people, places, and things, photographed by Caldwell on his trips to Asia, South America, Europe, and Africa. Completed 2/10/69

note.p: Outgoing correspondence of 252 letters. Chronologically arranged by days and months, letters are typescript and carbon copies. Four undated letters.

did.unittitle: Correspondence - Incoming. Incoming correspondence of 189 letters and 9 post cards. Alphabetically arranged, letters are typescript, holograph, and carbon copies. One letter without surname.
Manuscripts, jacket copies, gallies, dummies, and miscellaneous notes. Material includes 18 typescript and carbon copies of manuscripts etc. , alphabetically arranged.
Book Reviews. Material consists of 4 reviews of Caldwell's books. Alphabetically arranged by author: James Conaway; William J. Curtis; Virginia Kirkus; Edith Weigle.
Newspaper and magazine clippings. Approximately 15 clippings, dealing mainly with countries about which Caldwell has written.

note.p: Thirty-one photographs of people, places, and things in Asia, Central America, and Australia.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous. 2 calling cards; 2 records; several bills and receipts; a contract between John C. Caldwell and The John Day Company; a map of Central America.

note.p: 168 letters, typed. Nine undated letters in last folder. Listed alphabetically.
Arranged according to date. One card and 95 letters. Includes 3 unidentified letters dated Aug. 12, 1968 to "John", Oct. 15 to "Roberta", April 9, 1968 to "Ruth and family."

did.unittitle: Manuscript Materials - original MSS, carbon copies, revisions, jacket copies, etc.

note.p: Alphabetically arranged: Far Pacific Travel Guide, Let's Visit Afghanistan, Let's Visit Canada(Revisions, also from Japan, South Pacific, Venezuela, Brazil), LV Formosa (Revision, also for Turkey, West Indies), LV Ireland, LV Germany, LV India, LV Malaysia, LV Micronesia, LV Middle Africa, LV Middle East, LV Nigeria, LV Southeast Asia, LV the USA, LV West Africa, LV Yugoslavia, Massage Girl, New Travel Guide.
LV the USA; LV West Africa; LV Malaysia; LV Micronesia
LV Canada, LV Central America, LV Colombia, LV Middle Africa, LV Peru, LV Southeast Asia, LV West Indies Books - LV South Pacific, LV Southeast Asia; (cover of LV Nigeria)

did.unittitle: Business Agreements; Miscellaneous Magazine Clippings, Book reviews, Newspaper articles, Pictures in Massage Girl, Photographs, Brochures and Pamphlets, Miscellaneous.
